data.title: Leadup to Tri Week 25- Shin Chan
data.meta_description:
13 episodes, the first part of season 1.

Shin Chan!

Various general content warnings.  Thinking of it as you would Family Guy or South Park might be best...

#2

Man, this show is hilarious. We've had it dubbed in Spain since I was 15, I think. Not much of a plot, but you laugh a lot.

Also, if someone's curious, the films are very interesting. While their main target are children, adults will find a few gags directed to them.

Oh I do like this show. Real shame it didn't last longer. But it's just so funny and the original wasn't too bad either. I saw a movie once. Great that it keeps going after the tragic incident that happened to the creator.

#4

Real shame it didn't last longer.

Hm? I thought it was still running? Well, even if it isn't, I don't think this is a short one.

Nevermind, I've seen that it was canceled in 2010. Still, an anime that lasted 20 years and produced over 800 episodes is not short at all. Unless you mean the little kid: he's a flea. But boy, does he harrass girls... xD

#5

Real shame it didn't last longer.

Hm? I thought it was still running? Well, even if it isn't, I don't think this is a short one.

Nevermind, I've seen that it was canceled in 2010. Still, an anime that lasted 20 years and produced over 800 episodes is not short at all. Unless you mean the little kid: he's a flea. But boy, does he harrass girls... xD

The anime is still going, and the manga restarted with a new team with a slightly changed title after the creator died.

Usui fell off a cliff while climbing a mountain.

The manga's changed title simply added 'New' before the title, and the current creators are labeled as Team UY (UY being Usui's initials.)

Also be aware, the English version is in no way aimed at kids like the Japanese version and many dubs are. English dub is purely done for older people.

FranGP

#6

Also be aware, the English version is in no way aimed at kids like the Japanese version and many dubs are. English dub is purely done for older people.

I'll give the English dub a try, then. Although I'll add that if I ever have kids, I wouldn't let them watch this. It's quite inappropiate for small children. Maybe 12-14 years old, but in no way younger.

And you can make yourself an idea of Shinchan's echo in the media when I tell you that Usui's death made it to the news here
